skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior. Explores user intent, requirements and design before implementation.
skill.summary: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding function...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. All described behaviors (asking questions, presenting designs, writing documentation) are collaborative design activities consistent with the stated purpose. No network calls, no command execution, no data exfiltration paths detected.

content.user_title: Explore ideas through collaborative design dialogue
content.value_statement: Starting development without clear requirements leads to wasted effort and poor outcomes. This skill guides structured exploration of ideas through iterative questions and progressive design refinement.
actual_capabilities: Asks one question at a time to refine project requirements
Presents 2-3 design approaches with trade-offs and recommendations
Validates designs incrementally in sections of 200-300 words
Documents validated designs to docs/plans/*.md files
Creates git commits for design documents
Sets up git worktrees for isolated implementation
limitations: Does not execute code or modify existing project files
Does not access external APIs or services
Does not perform automated testing or deployment
Requires user input to answer clarifying questions

use_cases.title: Define feature requirements
use_cases.description: Clarify product vision and requirements through guided dialogue before engineering begins

use_cases.title: Design system architecture
use_cases.description: Explore technical approaches and trade-offs to create solid implementation plans

use_cases.title: Review design proposals
use_cases.description: Validate proposed solutions incrementally with stakeholder feedback loops

prompt_templates.title: New feature design
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add [feature description] to my project. Let's explore this idea through your brainstorming process.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture review
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to redesign our [component] to handle [new requirement]. What approaches should we consider?

prompt_templates.title: Refining requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm not sure exactly what I need. The goal is to achieve [outcome]. What questions should we ask to clarify requirements?

prompt_templates.title: Design validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Here's my initial idea for [feature]: [description]. Does this approach make sense? What am I missing?

output_examples.input: I want to add user authentication with social login to my web app
output: Let me understand your project context first. Before we dive in: What type of authentication backend do you currently have (if any)?
Key question: For social login, which providers would you like to support? (A) Google only, (B) Google + GitHub, (C) All major providers, (D) Something else
Great. Now let me understand your constraints: What user data do you need to store beyond authentication? Name, email, avatar?

best_practices: Use this skill before starting any new feature or significant code changes
Answer questions completely before moving to the next topic
Review each design section before proceeding to the next
anti_patterns: Skipping the brainstorming phase and jumping directly to implementation
Trying to answer multiple questions in a single response
Accepting the first design approach without exploring alternatives

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works the same across all platforms.

faq.question: How long does the brainstorming process take?
faq.answer: Typical sessions range from 10-30 minutes depending on feature complexity.

faq.question: Can I skip questions?
faq.answer: Answering all questions produces better designs. Skipping may result in incomplete requirements.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. No code execution, network calls, or data exfiltration.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the recommendations?
faq.answer: The skill presents options with reasoning. You choose the approach that fits your context.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompts?
faq.answer: Enforces structured exploration with one question at a time and incremental validation.
